 </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center"><B>Notice of 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Fellow Kroger Shareholders: </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>It is our pleasure to invite
you to join our Board of Directors, senior leadership, and other Kroger associates at The Kroger Co. Annual Meeting of Shareholders. </B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" ALIGN="center">

<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top">Thursday, June&nbsp;22, 2017, at 11:00 a.m. eastern time.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-size:1pt">

<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>

<TR STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top"><B>Items&nbsp;of&nbsp;Business:</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.80em; text-indent:-1.80em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">1. <FONT STYLE="font-size:9pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>To elect eleven director nominees.</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.80em; text-indent:-1.80em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">2. <FONT STYLE="font-size:9pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>To
approve our executive compensation, on an advisory basis.</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.80em; text-indent:-1.80em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">3. <FONT STYLE="font-size:9pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>To select the frequency of future advisory votes on executive
compensation, on an advisory basis.</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.80em; text-indent:-1.80em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">4. <FONT
STYLE="font-size:9pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>To ratify the selection of our independent auditor for fiscal year 2017.</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.80em; text-indent:-1.80em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">5. <FONT STYLE="font-size:9pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>To vote on four shareholder proposals, if properly presented at the
meeting.</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; margin-left:1.80em; text-indent:-1.80em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">6.
<FONT STYLE="font-size:9pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>To transact other business as may properly come before the meeting.</P></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-size:1pt">
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top"><B>Who can Vote:</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top">Holders of Kroger common shares at the close of business on the record date April&nbsp;26, 2017 are entitled to notice of and to vote at the meeting.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-size:1pt">
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top"><B>How to Vote:</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top">Your vote is important! Please vote your proxy in one of the following ways:</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-size:1pt">
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.80em; text-indent:-1.80em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">1.<I> <FONT STYLE="font-size:9pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>Via the internet</I>, by visiting
www.proxyvote.com.</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.80em; text-indent:-1.80em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">2.<I>
<FONT STYLE="font-size:9pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>By telephone</I>, by calling the number on your proxy card, voting instruction form or notice.</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.80em; text-indent:-1.80em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">3.<I> <FONT STYLE="font-size:9pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>By mail</I>, by marking, signing, dating and mailing your proxy card
if you requested printed materials, or your voting instruction form. No postage is required if mailed in the United States.</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; margin-left:1.80em; text-indent:-1.80em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">4.<I> <FONT STYLE="font-size:9pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>In person</I>, by attending the meeting in Cincinnati.</P></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-size:1pt">
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top"><B>Attending&nbsp;the&nbsp;Meeting:</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top">Shareholders holding shares at the close of business on the record date, or their duly appointed proxies, may attend the meeting. If you plan to attend the meeting, you must bring either: (1)&nbsp;the notice of meeting that was
separately mailed to you or (2)&nbsp;the top portion of your proxy card, either of which will be your admission ticket. You must also bring valid photo identification, such as a driver&#146;s license or passport.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-size:1pt">
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top"><B>Webcast&nbsp;of&nbsp;the&nbsp;Meeting:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top">If you are unable to attend the meeting, you may listen to a live webcast of the meeting by visiting ir.kroger.com at 11:00 a.m. eastern time on June&nbsp;22, 2017.</TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">We appreciate your continued confidence in Kroger, and we look forward to seeing you at the meeting. </P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" ALIGN="center">


<TR>
<TD WIDTH="33%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="33%"></TD>

<TD WIDTH="32%"></TD></TR>


<TR STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top">May&nbsp;10, 2017</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">By&nbsp;Order&nbsp;of&nbsp;the&nbsp;Board&nbsp;of&nbsp;Directors,</TD></TR>

<TD VALIGN="top">Cincinnati, Ohio</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P></div><br clear="All">

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">1 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<div style="width:97%; margin-top:1.5%; margin-left:1.5%; margin-right:-1.25%">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center"><B>Proxy Statement </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="right">May&nbsp;10, 2017 </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">We are providing this notice,
proxy statement and annual report to the shareholders of The Kroger Co. (&#147;Kroger&#148;, &#147;we&#148;, &#147;us&#148;, &#147;our&#148;) in connection with the solicitation of proxies by the Board of Directors of Kroger (the &#147;Board&#148;)
for use at the Annual Meeting of Shareholders to be held on June&nbsp;22, 2017, at 11:00 a.m. eastern time, at the School for Creative and Performing Arts, Corbett Theater, 108 W. Central Parkway, Cincinnati, Ohio 45202, and at any adjournments
thereof. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Our principal executive offices are located at 1014 Vine Street, Cincinnati, Ohio 45202-1100. Our telephone number is <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">513-762-4000.</FONT></FONT> This notice, proxy statement and annual report, and the accompanying proxy card were first furnished to shareholders on May&nbsp;10, 2017. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Who can vote? </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">You can vote if, as of the close of business
on April&nbsp;26, 2017, you were a shareholder of record of Kroger common shares. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Who is asking for my vote, and who pays for this proxy solicitation? </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Your proxy is being solicited by Kroger&#146;s Board of Directors. Kroger is paying the cost of solicitation. We have hired D.F. King&nbsp;&amp; Co.,
Inc., 48 Wall Street, New York, New York, a proxy solicitation firm to assist us in soliciting proxies and we will pay them a fee estimated not to exceed $16,000. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">We also will reimburse banks, brokers, nominees, and other fiduciaries for postage and reasonable expenses incurred by them in forwarding the proxy
material to beneficial owners of our common shares. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Proxies may be solicited personally, by telephone, electronically via the Internet, or by mail.
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Who are the members of the Proxy Committee? </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Robert D.
Beyer, W. Rodney McMullen, and Ronald L. Sargent, all Kroger Directors, are the members of the Proxy Committee for our 2017 Annual Meeting. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>How do I vote my
proxy? </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">You can vote your proxy in one of the following ways: </P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">1.</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><I>Via the internet,</I> by visiting www.proxyvote.com. </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">2.</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><I>By telephone,</I> by calling the number on your proxy card, voting instruction form, or notice. </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">3.</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><I>By mail,</I> by marking, signing, dating and mailing your proxy card if you requested printed materials, or your voting instruction form. No postage is required if mailed in the United States. </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">4.</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><I>In person,</I> by attending the meeting in Cincinnati. </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>What do I need to attend the meeting in person in
Cincinnati? </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">If you plan to attend the meeting, you must bring either: (1)&nbsp;the notice of meeting that was separately mailed to you or
(2)&nbsp;the top portion of your proxy card, either of which will be your admission ticket. You must also bring valid photo identification, such as a driver&#146;s license or passport. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Can I change or revoke my proxy? </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The common shares
represented by each proxy will be voted in the manner you specified unless your proxy is revoked before it is exercised. You may change or revoke your proxy by providing written notice to Kroger&#146;s Secretary at 1014 Vine Street, Cincinnati, Ohio
45202, in person at the meeting or by executing and sending us a subsequent proxy. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>How many shares are outstanding? </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">As of the close of business on April&nbsp;26, 2017, the record date, our outstanding voting securities consisted of 912,603,414 common shares. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P></div><br clear="All">

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">2 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<div style="width:97%; margin-top:1.5%; margin-left:1.5%; margin-right:-1.25%">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>How many votes per share? </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Each common share outstanding on the record date will be entitled to one vote on each of the 11 director nominees and one vote on each other proposal.
Shareholders may not cumulate votes in the election of directors. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>What voting instructions can I provide? </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">You may instruct the proxies to vote &#147;For&#148; or &#147;Against&#148; each proposal, or you may instruct the proxies to &#147;Abstain&#148; from
voting. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>What happens if proxy cards or voting instruction forms are returned without instructions? </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">If you are a registered shareholder and you return your proxy card without instructions, the Proxy Committee will vote in accordance with the
recommendations of the Board. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">If you hold shares in street name and do not provide your broker with specific voting instructions on proposals 1, 2,
3, 5, 6, 7, or 8, which are considered <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-routine</FONT> matters, your broker does not have the authority to vote on those proposals. This is generally referred to as a &#147;broker
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-vote.&#148;</FONT> Proposal 4, ratification of auditors, is considered a routine matter and, therefore, your broker may vote your shares according to your broker&#146;s discretion. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The vote required, including the effect of broker <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-votes</FONT> and abstentions for each of the matters presented for
shareholder vote, is set forth below. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>What are the voting requirements for each of the proposals? </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Proposal No.</B><B></B><B>&nbsp;1, Election of Directors</B>&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;An affirmative vote of the majority of the total number of votes cast
&#147;For&#148; or &#147;Against&#148; a director nominee is required for the election of a director in an uncontested election. A majority of votes cast means that the number of shares voted &#147;For&#148; a director nominee must exceed the number
of votes &#147;Against&#148; such director. Broker <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-votes</FONT> and abstentions will have no effect on this proposal. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Proposal No.</B><B></B><B>&nbsp;2, Advisory Vote to Approve Executive Compensation</B>&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;Advisory approval by shareholders of executive
compensation requires the affirmative vote of the majority of shares participating in the voting. Broker <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-votes</FONT> and abstentions will have no effect on this proposal. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Proposal No.</B><B></B><B>&nbsp;3, Advisory Vote on the Frequency of Future Advisory Votes on Executive Compensation</B>&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;The option,
be it every one, two, or three years, that receives the highest number of votes cast by shareholders will represent the vote on frequency of the advisory vote on executive compensation. Accordingly, broker
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-votes</FONT> and abstentions will have no effect on this proposal. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Proposal No.</B><B></B><B>&nbsp;4,
Ratification of Independent Auditors</B>&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;Ratification by shareholders of the selection of independent public accountants requires the affirmative vote of the majority of shares participating in the voting. Abstentions will have no
effect on this proposal. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Proposal Nos. 5, 6, 7, and 8, Shareholder Proposals</B>&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;The affirmative vote of the majority of shares
participating in the voting on a shareholder proposal is required for such proposal to pass. Accordingly, broker <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-votes</FONT> and abstentions will have no effect on these proposals. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>How does the Board of Directors recommend that I vote? </B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" ALIGN="center">


<TR>
<TD WIDTH="69%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="11%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="16%"></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#cccccc" STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1.00pt solid #000000; BORDER-TOP:1.00pt solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1.00pt solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1.00pt solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000"><B>For More<BR>Information</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1.00pt solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>

<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER:1.00pt solid #000000; padding-left:8pt; padding-right:2pt"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Important Notice Regarding the Availability of Proxy Materials for the
Shareholder<BR>Meeting to be Held on June&nbsp;22, 2017</B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The Notice of 2017 Annual Meeting,
Proxy Statement and 2016 Annual Report and the means to vote by internet are available at www.proxyvote.com.</P></TD></TR>

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P></div><br clear="All">

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">3 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<div style="width:97%; margin-top:1.5%; margin-left:1.5%; margin-right:-1.25%">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center"><B>Kroger&#146;s Corporate Governance Practices </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Kroger is committed to strong corporate governance. We believe that strong governance builds trust and promotes the long-term interests of our
shareholders. Highlights of our corporate governance practices include the following: </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Board Governance Practices </B></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman">&#10003;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">Strong Board oversight of enterprise risk. </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">4 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<div style="width:97%; margin-top:1.5%; margin-left:1.5%; margin-right:-1.25%">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center"><B>Proposals to Shareholders </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Item&nbsp;1. Election of Directors </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>You are being asked to elect 11
director nominees for a <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">one-year</FONT> term. The Board of Directors recommends that you vote FOR the election of all director nominees. </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">As of the date of this proxy statement, Kroger&#146;s Board of Directors consists of twelve members. In accordance with Kroger&#146;s director retirement
policy, Susan&nbsp;M.&nbsp;Phillips will be retiring from the Board immediately prior to the 2017 Annual Meeting and has not been nominated for <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">re-election.</FONT> In connection with Dr.&nbsp;Phillips&#146;
retirement, the Board will reduce its size to eleven directors. All nominees, if elected at the 2017 Annual Meeting, will serve until the annual meeting in 2018, or until their successors have been elected by the shareholders or by the Board
pursuant to Kroger&#146;s Regulations, and qualified. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Kroger&#146;s Articles of Incorporation provide that the vote required for election of a
director nominee by the shareholders, except in a contested election or when cumulative voting is in effect, is the affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast for or against the election of a nominee. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The experience, qualifications, attributes, and skills that led the Corporate Governance Committee and the Board to conclude that the following
individuals should serve as directors are set forth opposite each individual&#146;s name. The committee memberships stated below are those in effect as of the date of this proxy statement. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center"><B>Nominees for Directors for Terms of Office Continuing until 2018 </B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" ALIGN="center">


<TR>
<TD WIDTH="22%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="76%"></TD></TR>


<TR STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1.00pt solid #000000"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Nora A. Aufreiter</B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Age 57</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Director
Since 2014</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><I>Committees:</I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Financial Policy</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Public&nbsp;Responsibilities</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1.00pt solid #000000">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1.00pt solid #000000"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Ms.&nbsp;Aufreiter is a Director Emeritus of McKinsey&nbsp;&amp; Company, a global management consulting firm.
She retired in June 2014 after more than 27&nbsp;years with McKinsey, most recently as a director and senior partner. During that time, she worked extensively in the U.S., Canada, and internationally with major retailers, financial institutions and
other consumer-facing companies. Before joining McKinsey, Ms.&nbsp;Aufreiter spent three years in financial services working in corporate finance and investment banking. She is a member of the Board of Directors of The Bank of Nova Scotia, The
Neiman Marcus Group, and Cadillac Fairview, one of North America&#146;s largest owners, operators and developers of commercial real estate. Ms.&nbsp;Aufreiter also serves on the boards of St. Michael&#146;s Hospital and the Canadian Opera Company,
and is a member of the Dean&#146;s Advisory Board for the Ivey Business School in Ontario, Canada.</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Ms.&nbsp;Aufreiter has over 30 years of broad business experience in a variety of retail sectors. Her vast experience in leading McKinsey&#146;s North American Retail
Practice, North American Branding service line and the Consumer Digital and Omnichannel service line is of particular value to the Board. She also brings to the Board valuable insight on commercial real estate.</P></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1.00pt solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Robert D. Beyer,</B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><I>Lead Director</I></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Age 57</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Director
Since 1999</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><I>Committees:</I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Corporate Governance</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Financial Policy</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1.00pt solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1.00pt solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Mr.&nbsp;Beyer is Chairman of Chaparal Investments LLC, a private
investment firm and holding company that he founded in 2009. From 2005 to 2009, Mr.&nbsp;Beyer served as Chief Executive Officer of The TCW Group, Inc., a global investment management firm. From 2000 to 2005, he served as President and Chief
Investment Officer of Trust Company of the West, the principal operating subsidiary of TCW. Mr.&nbsp;Beyer is a member of the Board of Directors of Leucadia National Corporation. In the past five years he also served as a director of The Allstate
Corporation.</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Mr.&nbsp;Beyer brings to Kroger his experience as CEO of TCW, a global investment
management firm serving many of the largest institutional investors in the U.S. He has exceptional insight into Kroger&#146;s financial strategy, and his experience qualifies him to serve as a member of the Board. While at TCW, he also conceived and
developed the firm&#146;s risk management infrastructure, an experience that is useful to Kroger&#146;s Board in performing its risk management oversight functions. His abilities and service as a director were recognized by his peers, who selected
Mr.&nbsp;Beyer as an Outstanding Director in 2008 as part of the Outstanding Directors Program of the Financial Times. His strong insights into corporate governance form the foundation of his leadership role as Lead Director on the
Board.</P></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P></div><br clear="All">

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">5 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<div style="width:97%; margin-top:1.5%; margin-left:1.5%; margin-right:-1.25%">

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" ALIGN="center">


<TR>
<TD WIDTH="22%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="76%"></TD></TR>

<TR STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1.00pt solid #000000"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Anne Gates</B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Age 57</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Director
Since 2015</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><I>Committees:</I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Audit</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Public Responsibilities</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1.00pt solid #000000">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1.00pt solid #000000"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Ms.&nbsp;Gates is President of MGA Entertainment, Inc., a privately-held developer, manufacturer and marketer
of toy and entertainment products for children, a position she has held since 2014. Ms.&nbsp;Gates held roles of increasing responsibility with The Walt Disney Company from 1992-2012. Her roles included executive vice president, chief financial
officer for Disney Consumer Products, managing director for Disney Consumer Products Europe and Emerging Markets, and senior vice president of operations, planning and analysis. Prior to joining Disney, Ms.&nbsp;Gates worked for PepsiCo and Bear
Stearns.</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Ms.&nbsp;Gates has over 15 years of experience in the retail and consumer products
industry. She brings to Kroger financial expertise gained while serving as President of MGA and CFO of a division of The Walt Disney Company. Ms.&nbsp;Gates has a broad business background in finance, marketing, strategy and business development,
including international business. Her expertise in toy and entertainment products is of particular value to the Board. Ms.&nbsp;Gates has been designated an Audit Committee financial expert.</P></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1.00pt solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Susan J. Kropf</B></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Age 68</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Director Since 2007</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><I>Committees:</I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Compensation</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Corporate Governance</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1.00pt solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1.00pt solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Ms.&nbsp;Kropf was President and Chief Operating Officer of Avon Products
Inc., a manufacturer and marketer of beauty care products, from 2001 until her retirement in January 2007. She joined Avon in 1970 and, during her tenure at Avon, Ms.&nbsp;Kropf also served as Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer,
Avon North America and Global Business Operations from 1998 to 2000 and President, Avon U.S. from 1997 to 1998. Ms.&nbsp;Kropf was a member of Avon&#146;s Board of Directors from 1998 to 2006. She currently is a director of Avon Products, Inc., New
Avon, LLC, Coach, Inc., and Sherwin Williams Company. In the past five years she also served as a director of MeadWestvaco Corporation.</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Ms.&nbsp;Kropf has unique and valuable consumer insight, having led a major, publicly-traded beauty and related consumer products company. She has extensive experience
in manufacturing, marketing, supply chain operations, customer service, and product development, all of which assist her in her role as a member of Kroger&#146;s Board. Ms.&nbsp;Kropf has a strong financial background, and has significant boardroom
experience through her service on the boards of various public companies, including experience serving on compensation, audit, and corporate governance committees. She was inducted into the YWCA Academy of Women Achievers.</P></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>W. Rodney McMullen,</B></P>

<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Age 56</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Director Since 2003</P></TD>

Vice President in 1999 and Senior Vice President in 1997. Mr.&nbsp;McMullen is a director of Cincinnati Financial Corporation and VF Corporation.</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

having served as our CFO, and played a major role as architect of Kroger&#146;s strategic plan. His service on the compensation, executive, and investment committees of Cincinnati Financial Corporation and the audit and nominating and governance
committees of VF Corporation add depth to his extensive retail experience.</P></TD></TR></TABLE>

<TD WIDTH="22%"></TD>

<TD WIDTH="76%"></TD></TR>

<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1.00pt solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Mark S. Sutton</B></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Age 55</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Director Since 2017</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><I>Committees:</I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Audit</P>
